msItem.title: Muqaddimat Siyar al-Mutaʾakhkhirīn
مقدمة سیر المتأخرین

note.p: On f1v, there is a note which reads "W Jones 8th March 1788 sent to F. Gladwin". Gladwin was a professor of Persian literature at Fort William College in Bengal and long time associate of Jones.

msItem.incipit: بسم الله الرحمن الرحیم. الحمد لله رب العالمین ونصلی علی نبیه الکریم وآله المعصومین
msItem.explicit: وجهت اقتدار مارنا حقوق همین بندگی ونیکو خد منتهی بود
msItem.colophon: تم الکلام فی هذا المقام سنه 1197 هجری نبوبه صلی الله علیه وسلم

msItem.title: Siyar al-Mutaʾakhkhirīn
msItem.incipit: ستایش بیقیاس وستایش سرمدی اساس نثار بارکاه
msItem.explicit: مطابق سنه یکهزار ویکصد وپبحاه وسوم هجری نبوی صلی الله علیه وآله بزبان قلم داده آید منه الاعانه والتوفیق وخیر راحم وشفیق.
msItem.colophon: تم الکلام فی هذا المقام يوم الاحد ست عشرين من المحرم في سنة خمس وتسعين من المائة الثانية بعد الألف من الهجرة المقدسة على صاحبه السلام والتحية.

note.p: This is the first part of the text. The second part of the text is continued on f636v.

msItem.title: Siyar al-Mutaʾakhkhirīn
msItem.explicit: سید المرسلین محمد خاتم البین وعائلته المعصومین الطیبین الطاهرین علیه وعلیهم السلام والصلوة الی یوم الدین
msItem.colophon: یوم الثلثا تسع خلون من شهر رمضان المبارک المعظم فی سلک شهور سنة خمس وتسعین من المایه الثانیه عشرمن الهجره النبویه علی صاحبها السلام والتحیه

note.p: Both the date mentioned at the end of this section and the date at the previous section are presumably garbled. The date mentioned translates to the year 1881. Undoubtedly it ought to read 1195AH which would be 1781AD.
At the end of the section section after the colophon, there is a note which reads "This book is the property of Sir William Jones and was lent to Francis Gladwin Esq. 8th March 1788".

foliation.p: Infrequent European numerals in pencil. There is also some, very limited, Perso-Arabic numeral foliation in black ink which follows a different sequence.

condition.p: Spine is cracked, as is the binding. Some folios are coming loose from the binding. There are stains, smudges and marks on several folios and some folios have stuck together. Worm damage.

handDesc.summary: Neat black ink nastaʿlīq with rubrications.

additions.p: There are some Persian annotations and additions in the margins throughout the manuscript.
On f0v and f1r, Jones writes the title and notes that the "first part was copied verbatim, according to F. Gladwin, from the Maasir-i-Alamgiri"

accMat.p: There is a letter which accompanies the manuscript. The letter is from F. Gladwin, who thanks him for giving him Schulten's third book and gives him this manuscript, explaining the contents and where the first section was copied from ('Sajan Bey' and the Maʿāsir-i ʿĀlamgīrī).

provenance.p: RSPA 1-118 were presented to the Royal Society in January 1792 by Sir William and Lady Jones. According to Wilkins, this manuscript was presented by Sir William Jones.
The Royal Society's collection of 280 Persian and Arabic, and 86 Sanskrit manuscripts were transferred to the India Office Library in 1876.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on E. Denison Ross and E. G. Browne, Catalogue of two collections of Persian and Arabic manuscripts preserved in the India Office Library (London: Eyre and Spottiswoode, 1902), p. 8 no. XIII
